summary.intent: Find where global.yaml is read from in the gfetch project, then update documentation to include the missing `openvox` field.
summary.outcome: Documented that global.yaml is read from the root of the config directory in directory mode only. Updated docs/configuration.md, README.md, and config.example.yaml with openvox field details, then committed all staged changes.

repo: global.yaml is only used in directory mode (when --config points to a directory), not in single-file mode
The openvox field was undocumented prior to this session despite having a dedicated pkg/sync/openvox.go implementation
Config struct had Defaults field and hasDefaults tracking added in pkg/config/config.go as part of this session

code.finding: global.yaml path is constructed as filepath.Join(dir, "global.yaml") when --config argument is a directory
Dedicated file handles OpenVox mode logic including sanitization, pruning, and collision handling

workflow: User had changes pre-staged before asking for commit, so git status check was needed to understand the full scope of what would be committed
Staged changes included files beyond what was modified in the session (config.go, .gitignore, skills file), requiring inspection before committing

friction: The openvox field had no documentation at all despite being a significant feature with its own source file
Staged changes included unrelated files (skills/golang/SKILLS.md, .gitignore) bundled into the same commit as doc updates
open_items: Verify that the new OpenVox Mode section in docs/configuration.md accurately reflects all edge cases in openvox.go (sanitization rules, pruning behavior, collision handling details)
The temp/global.yaml file appears in modified files list â€” unclear if this is intentional test data or leftover artifact that should be cleaned up
